title: Adjust the logging levels for OO Workflow Designer
content:
The logging activity can slow the performance of Operations Orchestration (OO) Workflow Designer and create large log files, it's important for OO to run with appropriate logging levels.

The default logging level set is INFO. This level provides the necessary information without impacting performance.

In addition to this, you can also adjust the granularity of the information in the log for regular logging, deployment, and for execution.

The available granularity options are:

  • INFO - Default logging information
  • DEBUG - More logging information
  • WARN - Less logging information
  • ERROR - Less logging information

To adjust the granularity in the logging:

  1. Open the log4j.properties file (under /<installation_folder>/designer/conf/log4j.properties).

  2. Replace INFO with DEBUG, WARN or ERROR as in the following example.

    For example:

    
log.level=INFO
execution.log.level=DEBUG
deployment.log.level=DEBUG

Access Tomcat server logs

The Tomcat server keeps access logs under /<installation_folder>/designer/var/logs. To prevent these log files from growing in size, it's recommended that you monitor the size of the files named localhost_access_log.yyyy-mm-dd.txt, and delete old files as necessary. It's recommended to use established best practices appropriate for your operating system

The following example is to delete files that are older than 10 days:

Linux

find <OO_HOME>/designer/var/logs/ -name " localhost_access*.txt" 
-type f -mtime +10 -exec rm -f {} \;

Windows

C:\Users\Administrator>forfiles /p "<OO_HOME>\designer\var\logs" /s /m 
localhost_access*.txt /d -10 /c "cmd /c del @PATH"

Where <OO_HOME> refers to the location of the OO Workflow Designer installation folder
